intro: Tithymalus altus, commonly known as the tall tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Tithymalus altus grows in moist, shady habitats such as woodlands and stream sides, and it is often found in association with other shade-tolerant flora. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and naturalized areas.
